newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Universal 1997 net seen at 1.025 bln pesos.
newsitem.headline: Universal 1997 net seen at 1.025 bln pesos.

text.p: Universal Rightfield Property Holdings Inc said on Saturday it expected its net income to hit 1.025 billion pesos from 414 million last year.
"Income growth this year will be propelled by the launching of (the company's) innovative leisure product, Universal Leisure Club," the firm said in a statement.

Universal Leisure Corp, a subsidiary of Universal Rightfield, has started selling an additional 1,000 "membership shares" in Universal Leisure Club Inc after it completed an initial offer of 1,000 shares.

Universal Rightfield said Universal Leisure Club's initial offer of 1,000 shares was underwritten on a firm basis by a group of investment banks that include Abacus Capital and Investment Corp and Keppel IVI Investments Inc.
"Tenders for the membership shares of Universal Leisure Club ... exceeded the volume of the offering which started March 4, 1997," it said.
Universal Leisure Club is a unit of Universal Leisure Corp.

Buyers of the shares are given the right to use Universal Leisure Club's facilities composed of a sports club and another business club in the city, two mountain resorts with an 18-hole golf course each, and one beach club.
